articles.headline: Apollo Clients Await Inquiry’s Findings on Chief and Jeffrey Epstein
articles.snippet: Leon Black, Apollo Global Management’s co-founder and leader, has been facing questions from investors over his ties to the convicted sex offender. One has already opted to withhold new investment.
articles.abstract: Leon Black, Apollo Global Management’s co-founder and leader, has been facing questions from investors over his ties to the convicted sex offender. One has already opted to withhold new investment.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leon Black helped start Apollo Global Management three decades ago out of the ashes of a junk-bond scandal and built a $400 billion private-equity powerhouse, handling the investments of institutions around the globe, from public pension systems in California to sovereign wealth funds controlled by foreign governments.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein, Mary Williams Walsh and Matt Phillips

articles.headline: Trump’s Manufacturing Promises Disappoint as Economy Sours
articles.snippet: Foxconn’s failure to deliver on a Wisconsin project underscores the limits of the president’s power to make companies bend to his will.
articles.abstract: Foxconn’s failure to deliver on a Wisconsin project underscores the limits of the president’s power to make companies bend to his will.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At a 2018 groundbreaking ceremony for a Foxconn plant in Wisconsin, President Trump declared that the factory would be the “eighth wonder of the world” — a $10 billion hub that would hire 13,000 workers to make flat-screen televisions in America’s heartland.

articles.headline: Senate Confirms Barrett, Delivering for Trump and Reshaping the Court
articles.snippet: The vote capped a brazen feat for Republicans, who pushed through a Supreme Court nominee in little more than five weeks with the election looming.
articles.abstract: The vote capped a brazen feat for Republicans, who pushed through a Supreme Court nominee in little more than five weeks with the election looming.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Judge Amy Coney Barrett, a conservative appeals court judge and protégée of former Justice Antonin Scalia, was confirmed on Monday to the Supreme Court, capping a lightning-fast Senate approval that handed President Trump a victory ahead of the election and promised to tip the court to the right for years to come.

articles.headline: How Trump and Bolsonaro Broke Latin America’s Covid-19 Defenses
articles.snippet: The two presidents drove out 10,000 Cuban doctors and nurses. They defunded the region’s leading health agency. They wrongly pushed hydroxychloroquine as a cure.
articles.abstract: The two presidents drove out 10,000 Cuban doctors and nurses. They defunded the region’s leading health agency. They wrongly pushed hydroxychloroquine as a cure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus was gathering lethal speed when President Trump met his Brazilian counterpart, Jair Bolsonaro, on March 7 for dinner at Mar-a-Lago. Mr. Bolsonaro had canceled trips that week to Italy, Poland and Hungary, and Brazil’s health minister had urged him to stay away from Florida, too.

articles.headline: Recession’s Silver Lining: American Households Are Doing Better Than Expected
articles.snippet: With few avenues for spending and big purchases on hold, many Americans are saving more and paying off debts, helped by loan deferrals and relief aid.
articles.abstract: With few avenues for spending and big purchases on hold, many Americans are saving more and paying off debts, helped by loan deferrals and relief aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: For months, Americans have barely dined at restaurants or traveled for vacation. There have been no ballgames or concerts to attend. Gym and other memberships mostly remain frozen.

articles.headline: Airbnb Fights Its ‘Party House Problem’
articles.snippet: Noise. Damages. Safety questions. Airbnb is racing to address the risks posed by partying guests before it goes public.
articles.abstract: Noise. Damages. Safety questions. Airbnb is racing to address the risks posed by partying guests before it goes public.
articles.lead_paragraph: The luxury cabin in Incline Village, Nev., just north of Lake Tahoe, has a hot tub, a sauna, a pool table, a fire pit, two patios and a backyard full of towering pine trees. It sleeps 14, according to its listing on Airbnb. And it has been a nightmare for Sara Schmitz, a retiree who lives next door.

articles.headline: Why the Best G.D.P. Report Ever Won’t Mean the Economy Has Healed
articles.snippet: Government data on Thursday will show a record-setting rebound in economic output. But the numbers are misleading.
articles.abstract: Government data on Thursday will show a record-setting rebound in economic output. But the numbers are misleading.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States almost certainly just experienced its fastest three months of economic growth on record. That doesn’t mean the economy is strong.
